title: 112_s3453
content: The "Fair Minimum Wage Act of 2012" may be cited as the Act. It includes provisions for minimum wage increases. The Fair Minimum Wage Act of 2012 increases the minimum wage to $8.10 an hour initially, with subsequent increases to $8.95, $9.80, and further adjustments based on consumer price index. The Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 is amended to determine the minimum wage based on the annual increase in the Consumer Price Index for Urban Wage Earners and Clerical Workers. The Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 is amended to determine the minimum wage based on the annual increase in the Consumer Price Index for Urban Wage Earners and Clerical Workers. The calculation involves comparing the current month, quarter, or year's Consumer Price Index with the previous year's index to adjust the minimum wage accordingly. The cash wage for tipped employees must not be less than a specified amount. The Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 is amended to determine the minimum wage based on the annual increase in the Consumer Price Index for Urban Wage Earners and Clerical Workers. The minimum wage shall be adjusted annually until it reaches 70 percent of the wage in effect under section 6(a)(1). The Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 is amended to adjust the minimum wage annually based on the Consumer Price Index until it reaches 70 percent of the wage under section 6(a)(1). The wage will be rounded to the nearest multiple of $0.05 to ensure it remains at 70 percent of the specified wage. The Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 is amended to adjust the minimum wage annually based on the Consumer Price Index until it reaches 70 percent of the wage under section 6(a)(1). The Secretary must announce any increase in the minimum wage 60 days prior to its effective date. The amendments made by subsections (a) and (b) will take effect on the first day of the third month after the enactment of this Act.
